item.title: Graffiti on a bike bin and the front of Symons Close, 1st February
item.description:
Graffiti was left on a bike bin on the corner of Kimberley Avenue and Evelina Road, and also two areas of graffiti on the front walls of Symons Close on 31st January.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61a, Kimberley Avenue, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive fly tipping problem, 1st February
item.description:
Huge amount of domestic waste dumped over a long period of time. Now also attracting animals and being used by dog owners to dump poo-bags, causing smell. This area is immediately behind a nursery - children walk by regularly and it is open access.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Croston Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tesco social responsibility towards litter, 1st February
item.description:
Tesco is not showing any social responsibility towards the road they make so much profit on. Their products end up in the immediate waste bins. They refuse to clean the area directly in front of their shop. It is not acceptable to push the problem to the locals who already litter pick or to the council to increase collections when funds are limited . We would like Tesco to show some responsibility towards the road. Their business is a fantastic success and has increased traffic on the local roads, partly causing demand for a new roundabout which has caused increased traffic congestion and pollution. Please may we respectfully ask that Tesco takes some responsibility by tidying up the excess litter created by their business.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 133, South Eden Park Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: With restriction outside Acland burghley school, 1st February
item.description:
On 1/2/26 at 7pm I was driving through the width restriction on Burghley road outside acland burghley school when my vehicle was damaged. The width restriction is extremely narrow and difficult to navigate safely, even at very low speed I was driving, in addition to that the weather was raining heavily which also cause my car to slip. There is limited visibility and insufficient clearance for standard-sized vehicles, and the kerbs/barriers are positioned in a way that leaves no margin for error. As a result, my car (Mazda mx30 reg: WA21 LFL) made contact with the side of the restriction, causing visible damage to the front left wing and bumper. I believe the layout and design of this width restriction make it unsafe for regular vehicles and that it directly caused the damage to my car. I have attached photos of the damage, the restriction itself. I am seeking reimbursement for the repair costs as the damage occurred due to an unsafe and poorly designed road feature maintained by the council. This isn’t the first time that this width restriction has scratched my car and damaged a lot of others cars.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burghley Road, Tufnell Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dropped pavement for pathway on Brill pl, 1st February
item.description:
The dropped pathway leading to the pathway has recently ( in last few months ) been rebuilt but it's not level with the road? There is a lip of an inch or 2 at the junction of the road and pavement which means crossing the road from Francis Cricks institute to the pathway on my mobility scooter isn't possible as it's not level and dangerous. I have no idea if the rebuild was done by Camden or others. I complained about this on 19th Jan COMLR26188 but haven't had a response.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brill Place, Somers Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brand new street dirty as council hasn't maintained, 1st February
item.description:
There is 100s of bits of chewing gum, filthy bins, black sludge spots around all street furniture, the whole street needs a jet wash, simple fix. It will degrade so much faster if you continue to neglect.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powis Street, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Harvington Park - Litter, 1st February
item.description:
I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. ///tones.strict.chained https://w3w.co/tones.strict.chained Lots of litter caught up in undergrowth and bushes next to path. There is also litter in the bushes along the path towards the woodland area. Can ALL the litter be removed. Please ensure this request is only marked as closed once the work has been completed. Issues are regularly closed before action has been taken, which leads to unnecessary re-reporting. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leaveland Close, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
